_meta.description: Bicameral machine-readable extraction of 104th IL General Assembly rules (Senate SR-4 + House Rules). Lookup table for action classifier, feature engineering, lifecycle logic, and UI.

bill_to_law_process.title: Introduction of Bill
bill_to_law_process.body: A member of the Senate or the House introduces a bill, which is assigned a unique identifying number (e.g., "H.B. ___" for House bills and "S.B. ___" for Senate bills). If not enacted, it must be reintroduced in the next General Assembly with a new number.

bill_to_law_process.title: Committee Work — Hearings
bill_to_law_process.body: The bill goes to the appropriate committee, which holds hearings to gather expert opinions and determine the need for the legislation.

bill_to_law_process.title: Committee Work — Markup, Amendments, Report
bill_to_law_process.body: The committee may make amendments to the bill. If approved, a committee report endorsing the bill is issued.

bill_to_law_process.title: Floor Debate
bill_to_law_process.body: The bill is debated and can be further amended. The debate transcripts are accessible online for public viewing.

bill_to_law_process.title: Passage and Consideration in Second Chamber
bill_to_law_process.body: If the bill passes in the first chamber, it moves to the second chamber for a similar review process. If both chambers approve, it goes to the governor.

bill_to_law_process.title: Gubernatorial Action
bill_to_law_process.body: The governor can sign the bill into law, veto it, or take no action (resulting in an automatic law after 60 days). The type of veto can be total or amendatory. Once signed, the bill becomes a Public Act and is assigned a Public Act number.

FILED.description: Bill introduced, read by title a first time, automatically referred to gatekeeper committee (Senate: Assignments; House: Rules Committee).

IN_COMMITTEE.description: Bill assigned to a standing committee. Committee may report do pass, do not pass, do pass as amended, without recommendation, tabled, or let it die without action.

PASSED_COMMITTEE.description: Bill favorably reported. Stands on the order of Second Reading. May be amended only on Second Reading.

FLOOR_VOTE.description: Bill on Third Reading for final vote. Must have been read by title on three different days before passage.

CHAMBER_PASSED.description: Bill passed origin chamber on roll call vote of majority of those elected (Senate: 30 votes; House: 60 votes).

CROSSED_CHAMBERS.description: Bill received by second chamber, read a first time, referred to that chamber's gatekeeper (Assignments or Rules Committee).

PASSED_BOTH.description: Bill passed both chambers. If amended by second chamber, first chamber must concur, non-concur, or request conference. Sent to Governor.

GOVERNOR.description: Bill before the Governor. May be signed, vetoed (total, item, amendatory, reduction), or allowed to become law without signature.

SIGNED.description: Bill signed by the Governor or became law without signature. Terminal positive state.

VETOED.description: Bill vetoed by Governor. May be overridden by three-fifths of those elected in each chamber.

procedural.name: assignments
procedural.description: Senate gatekeeper. All bills automatically referred here after first reading. 6 members (4 majority, 2 minority). Assigns bills to standing committees.

procedural.name: rules committee
procedural.description: House gatekeeper. All bills automatically referred here after first reading. 5 members (3 majority, 2 minority). Refers bills to standing/special committees. Also controls floor amendments, joint action motions, and conference reports.

procedural.name: executive
procedural.description: Standing committee in both chambers but handles broad procedural/policy matters. High volume makes it a near-procedural catch-all for policy signal purposes.

procedural.name: executive appointments
procedural.description: Handles gubernatorial nominations requiring Senate confirmation. Not a substantive policy committee for bill classification purposes.

committees: Child Care Accessibility & Early Childhood Education
Elementary & Secondary Education: Administration, Licensing, & Charter Schools

introduction.description: Bill introduced, read first time, referred to gatekeeper (Senate: Assignments; House: Rules Committee).

assignment.description: Gatekeeper refers bill to a standing committee. Senate: Assignments refers. House: Rules Committee refers.

committee_action.description: Committee votes or acts on the bill. First major hurdle; most bills die here.
committee_action.senate_unfavorable_disposition: Rule 3-12(a): reported unfavorably shall lie on the table.
committee_action.house_unfavorable_disposition: Rule 24(a): reported unfavorably shall lie on the table.
committee_action.house_two_vote_limit: Rule 22(g): no bill may be voted on more than twice on motions to report favorably. After 2 failures, automatically reported unfavorably.

deadline.description: Deadline-related actions. Bills missing deadlines are re-referred to gatekeeper — NOT killed, but significantly slowed.

senate_deadline_types.description: Final day for standing committees to report Senate bills.
Final day for standing committees to report Senate appropriation bills.
Final day for Third Reading and passage of Senate bills.
Final day for Third Reading and passage of Senate appropriation bills.
Optional deadline for conference committee reports.

house_deadline_types.description: Final day for standing committees to report House bills.
Final day for standing committees to report House appropriation bills.
Final day for Third Reading and passage of House bills.
Final day for Third Reading and passage of House appropriation bills.
Final day for joint action motions and conference committee reports.

floor_process.description: Bill on Second or Third Reading on the floor. Three readings on three different days required before passage.
floor_process.senate_second_reading: Rule 3-12(a): favorably reported bills stand on Second Reading.
floor_process.house_second_reading: Rule 24(a): favorably reported bills placed on Second Reading.
floor_process.third_reading_rule: Both chambers: bill read by title on 3 different days before passage.

house_debate_types.short: Rule 52(a)(1): 2min sponsor + 2min response + 1min close. 7 members can upgrade to standard.

floor_vote.description: Roll call vote on passage. Requires majority of those elected (Senate: 30; House: 60).

cross_chamber.description: Bill passed one chamber and received by the other. Referred to second chamber's gatekeeper.

concurrence.description: First chamber considers second chamber's amendments. May concur, non-concur, or request conference.
concurrence.conference_report_requirement: Signed by at least 6 conferees (Senate Rule 8-3(b), House Rule 74(b)).
concurrence.second_conference_rule: If first fails, second may be requested. If second fails, bill is lost (Senate Rule 8-5(b), House Rule 76(c)).
concurrence.house_two_vote_limit: Rule 72(c): motions are renewable but may not be voted on more than twice.

governor.description: Governor acts on passed bill. Sign, veto (total/item/amendatory/reduction), or allow to become law.

veto_types.description: Governor returns with specific recommendations. Must not alter fundamental purpose. Accept by majority or override by 3/5.

veto_process.description: Legislature considers governor's veto. Override requires 3/5 of those elected in each chamber.

enacted.description: Bill signed into law or became law without Governor's signature.

cosponsor.description: Sponsorship actions. Principal sponsor listed first; up to 4 chief cosponsors with approval.
cosponsor.senate_sponsor_control: Rule 5-1(b): principal sponsor controls the bill.
cosponsor.house_sponsor_control: Rule 37(b): principal sponsor controls the bill.

amendment.description: Amendment actions. Committee amendments in committee; floor amendments on Second Reading only.
amendment.senate_amendment_approval: Rule 5-4(e), Rule 3-8(b): amendments must be approved by Assignments.
amendment.house_amendment_approval: Rule 18(e): amendments must be referred by Rules Committee.

resolution.description: Resolution actions including consent calendar and congratulatory resolutions.

appointment.description: Executive appointment confirmation. Senate only. 60-session-day window to act.

procedural.description: Administrative and procedural actions (adjournment, quorum, etc.).

favorable_report.senate_disposition: Bill stands on order of Second Reading (Rule 3-12(a)).
favorable_report.house_disposition: Bill placed on order of Second Reading (Rule 24(a)).

tabled.description: Principal sponsor may table own bill with leave. Not debatable or amendable.
tabled.senate_recovery: Rule 7-11: take from table requires majority elected (if Assignments recommends) or 3/5 elected (otherwise).
tabled.house_recovery: Rule 61: take from table requires majority elected (if Rules Committee recommends) or 71 elected (otherwise).

re_referred_deadline.description: Bill missed deadline and automatically re-referred to gatekeeper (Assignments/Rules). NOT dead — can be re-referred or advanced.

re_referred_inactivity.description: All measures re-referred to gatekeeper on 31st consecutive day chamber has not convened, unless excepted.

passed_chamber.description: Bill passed on roll call vote of majority of those elected.

vetoed.recovery: Override by 3/5 of those elected in each chamber.

signed_into_law.description: Governor signed or bill became law without signature.

conference_failed.description: If either chamber refuses report of second conference committee, bill is lost.

consent_calendar.description: Non-controversial bill placed on consent calendar. No debate permitted. House: must stand 2 days on 2nd Reading + 2 days on 3rd Reading before vote.
consent_calendar.house_exclusions: Rule 42(e): no revenue or appropriation bills; no bills needing >60 votes.

simple_majority.description: Simple majority of those present and voting. 'Present' votes not counted.

majority_of_those_appointed.description: Absolute majority of total members appointed to a committee. Excludes ex-officio/non-voting members in House.

majority_of_those_elected.description: Absolute majority of total members entitled to be elected. Irrespective of vacancies.
used_for: passage of bills (Senate Rule 5-1(f), House Rule 37(f))
take from table with gatekeeper recommendation
take from table without gatekeeper recommendation (House Rule 61: 71 votes)
overrule presiding officer (Senate Rule 7-7; House Rule 57: 71 votes)
passage after May 31 with early effective date (Senate Rule 7-19; House Rule 69)
disciplinary action resulting in expulsion (House Rule 97(c): 79 votes)

senate_schedule.authority: President establishes deadlines. Filed with Secretary and journalized.

house_schedule.authority: Speaker establishes deadlines. Filed with Clerk and journalized. May reschedule at discretion.

senate_re_referral_deadline.trigger: Bill fails to meet Rule 2-10 deadline.
senate_re_referral_deadline.effect: Automatically re-referred to Committee on Assignments.

house_re_referral_deadline.trigger: Bill fails to meet Rule 9 deadline for committee report, Third Reading, or joint action.
exceptions: Bill already passed but subject to further consideration (Rule 65)

senate_re_referral_inactivity.trigger: Senate has not convened for 31 consecutive days.
senate_re_referral_inactivity.effect: All measures re-referred to Assignments (except constitutional amendments and Appointment Messages).

house_re_referral_inactivity.trigger: House has not convened for 31 consecutive days.
house_re_referral_inactivity.effect: All measures re-referred to Rules Committee.

effective_date.description: Bill passed after May 31 with effective date before next June 1 requires 3/5 vote. If only majority passes, returned to Second Reading for amendment.

even_year_restriction.description: During even-numbered years, gatekeeper refers only budget appropriation bills and emergency/substantial government measures.
even_year_restriction.effect: Most non-budget bills cannot advance in even-numbered years.
